main¶

Orchestration workflow for scrape, clean, normalize, and load operations.

main._run_LLM_pipeline(input_json_path, output_jsonl_path)[source]¶

Run the local LLM normalization script over a JSON input file.

The function invokes llm_hosting/app.py as a subprocess and writes line-delimited JSON output incrementally to the requested file.

Parameters:

  • input_json_path (str) – Path to JSON input payload.

  • output_jsonl_path (str) – Path where normalized JSONL should be written.

Returns:

None.

Return type:

None

main.main()[source]¶

Execute the full initial ingestion pipeline.

This function scrapes fresh data, cleans it, saves canonical JSON, and runs the LLM normalization stage to produce JSONL output.

Returns:

None.

Return type:

None

main._append_json_records(records, path)[source]¶

Append new records to an existing JSON array file.

If the destination file exists but is not a JSON list, it is treated as an empty list before appending.

Parameters:

  • records (list[dict]) – Records to append.

  • path (str | pathlib.Path) – Target JSON file path.

Returns:

None.

Return type:

None

main._append_jsonl_records(source_jsonl_path, target_jsonl_path)[source]¶

Append non-empty JSONL lines from one file to another.

Parameters:

  • source_jsonl_path (str | pathlib.Path) – Source JSONL file.

  • target_jsonl_path (str | pathlib.Path) – Destination JSONL file.

Returns:

None.

Return type:

None

main.update_new_records()[source]¶

Scrape and ingest only records that are newer than current database data.

Existing URLs and maximum result page are used to reduce duplicate work. New records are cleaned, normalized with the LLM pipeline, appended to cumulative JSON/JSONL datasets, and inserted into PostgreSQL.

Returns:

Status dictionary describing whether records were added.

Return type:

dict[str, str | int]
